newsitem.title: USA: Merger of DBSIndustries unit, EchoStar OK'd.
newsitem.headline: Merger of DBSIndustries unit, EchoStar OK'd.

text.p: DBSIndustries Inc said on Wednesday the Federal Communications Commission had approved the merger between EchoStar Communications Corp and Direct Broadcasting Satellite Corp (DBSC) which is 24.8 percent owned by DBSI.

In exchange for its ownership in DBSC, DBSIndustries will receive 270,414 Class A Common Shares of EchoStar stock, or about 0.6 percent of EchoStar's outstanding Class A Common Stock. The EchoStar stock closed on the Nasdaq exchange at $24 per share on Tuesday.
The merger is intended to strengthen EchoStar's competitive position within the direct-to-home satellite market and enhance their development of future direct broadcast satellite (DBS) services.
Both EchoStar and DBSC, a wholly owned subsidiary of EchoStar as a result of the merger, each hold one of the nine DBS permits issued by the FCC.
